axes.description: The axes to get the angle values to calculate, and compare to.
axes.markdownDescription: The axes to get the angle values to calculate, and compare to.

actor_rotation.description: Determines the initial point of the rotation for the actor. Accepts `"head"` or `"body"`.
actor_rotation.markdownDescription: Determines the initial point of the rotation for the actor. Accepts `"head"` or `"body"`.

target_rotation.description: Determines the initial point of the rotation for the target. Accepts `"head"` or `"body"`.
target_rotation.markdownDescription: Determines the initial point of the rotation for the target. Accepts `"head"` or `"body"`.

comparison.description: Determines how the calculated angle value will be compared to the specified value.
comparison.markdownDescription: Determines how the calculated angle value will be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: The value to compare the calculated angle value to.
compare_to.markdownDescription: The value to compare the calculated angle value to.

type.description:
## Relative Rotation --- [Bi-entity Condition Type](https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/bientity_condition_types/relative_rotation) Compares the rotation angle of the 'actor' to the 'target'. Type ID: `origins:relative_rotation` --- ### Examples ```json "bientity_condition": { "type": "origins:relative_rotation", "actor_rotation": "head", "target_rotation": "body", "comparison": ">=", "compare_to": -0.8 } ``` This example will check if the actor and target are essentially facing each other.
```json "bientity_condition": { "type": "origins:relative_rotation", "actor_rotation": "head", "target_rotation": "body", "comparison": ">=", "compare_to": 0.4 } ``` This example will check if the actor's head is essentially facing the same way as the target's body.
